Both my parents are singers. And my dad has even been a part of a band for a few years. The secret behind why they have different mic colors.. ready for it!It’s because they need to have it that way because they are in a group. Yup, that’s why folks. So when you are a group and don’t have much money you actually can’t afford to get different colored mics. But they are very necessary as each singer has a different voice, tone, loudness, and quite a few other things that factor into the microphone and its little microphone settings. Normally, when you don’t have a bunch of money for custom microphones and cases you can lug around the world with you everywhere. You can put a little piece of tape or a little tag on your temporary microphone that has been customed tuned as best it can to your settings. Now sound engineers will do this for you as they attempt to get the settings as good as they can in the little time they have to get to know you. But yeah since there are seven boys with seven different voices and tones they do this so that they know and the sound guys know whose microphone is whose. Have you ever noticed that when a microphone dies and someone lends someone else their mic instead that it sounds off, or not as good? That is because the microphone is tweaked and tuned specifically for that person's voice and preferences. So while the mic works for another person, it just won’t ever sound as great. And the thing is it takes sometimes days or months to figure out the tuning and tweaks to make a microphone your own. And you don’t want to have to reset that up every time. So the fact is they bring their own mics with them. And these mics are set up perfectly to match their voices. So that they can sound the best they can be on stage. To do this and make the best possible performance for you guys they have to have some way to differentiate their microphones apart. So they use colors. A very standard practice in the industry. So with how rich they are, they have fully colored mics so that there will be no confusion on this matter. Some people who don’t have as much money can use electrical tape, colored rings, colored covers, handle wrappers, or microphone jewels. These colors themself is something BTS picked probably based on their own preferences… But the meaning behind them all having their own different colored mics and not all say white or black is literally so Jin doesn’t take Tae’s mic or vice versa. Actually a fun example of this if you ever want to keep an eye out for it is. if you ever see a bunch of idols on stage and someone goes and starts talking then looks confused and looks at their mic, then another idol comes up to them and hands them the mic they have. Yuppers you guessed it, they stole each other's mics and are probably thinking, WTH is up with my mic. Artists trading mics. 99% of the time this is because they grabbed the microphone that was calibrated for someone else voice. the other 1% of the time is if the mic is dead. Most of the time when this happens they just laugh it off and thank each other especially if they are int the same group. It’s not a big deal after all. So the answer to why they have different colors. Is because they are rich they can afford to differentiate their mic in a pleasing way for themselves but that is noticeable for the workers/staff and other members there too. Fans can just enjoy the visuals though and think about the fun color-matching to their personality instead. Because it is true they probably all picked colors they like. But, Yeah, ALL singers would have custom microphones if they could afford them. Because it is necessary for all singers to have one if they want their voice to sound the best it can be. Of course, they can use a standard mic set to any setting, but it just isn’t going to sound the same. I hope that helped answer the question. XD
